title: Arlo's new Pro 5S offers top-of-the-line security features – if you can afford it
description: The Pro 5S adds data encryption and connectivity during power outages, but requires you to buy a $200 security system.

title: New phishing campaign lures victims with new Elon Musk Twitter verification rules
description: No, the Twitter blue checkmark doesn't cost $20 and no, you won't get it for free.

title: Bitdefender wants to help protect your live chat
description: Bitdefender claims industry-first tool to help users spot threats delivered via messenging tools like WhatsApp.

title: Facebook makes it easier to earn money from Reels online
description: Facebook expands professional mode feature to help content creators build an online presence and social media following.

title: WordPress updates its website builder for the third time this year
description: WordPress 6.1 offers new design features and tools aimed at easing the site building experience.

title: AMD promises powerful RDNA 3 GPUs with a secret weapon
description: Namely something for high-fps gaming – and given that Nvidia now has DLSS 3, we’ve got a fair guess what AMD has up its sleeve.

title: HBO confirms The Last of Us TV show release date following HBO Max leak

title: The Apple Store’s $330 Level Lock Plus smart lock isn’t as secure as you’d think
description: The Level Lock Plus smart lock sold at the Apple Store isn't as secure as its $330 price implies; one expert has shown that a novice could pick it open.

title: These malicious Android apps have been downloaded over a million times
description: Utility apps spreading trojans through the Play Store again, placing more than a million Android users at risk.

description: The number of reported ransomware incidents increased by almost 200% year-on-year.

description: Sony just announced the price and release date for the PSVR 2 headset, and the price tag might shock you

description: However the incident is more of a nuisance than an actual problem, Dropbox reassures users.
